intro: Haplopappus blanchetii, commonly known as the desert pappus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh, dry environments, with small, fleshy leaves that reduce water loss. Its pale yellow to white flowers bloom in late spring, and the plant produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Haplopappus blanchetii is often found in rocky soils and is an important part of the desert ecosystem.
